==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|止|戈|t1=foot; to walk; to stop|t2=spear|ls=ic}} – army going on [[expedition]].

The graphical origin of {{lang|zh|武}} is described in the ''[[w:Spring and Autumn Annals|Spring and Autumn Annals]]'' {{defdate|481 BC}} as “to stop violence” ({{lang|zh|[[止]][[戈]][[為]][[武]]}}) – the ultimate state of warfare. This may be a misinterpretation as {{zh-l|*止}} is frequently used to mean “to walk”, not “to stop”.

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|む}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ぶ}} {{m|zh|武|tr=mju<sup>X</sup>||military}}.

The [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading of ''mu'', so likely the initial borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|む}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|む}}

# [[military]], [[martial]]

=====Usage notes=====
Only found in compounds. Not as common as the ''bu'' reading.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|武者|むしゃ}}: a [[warrior]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ぶ}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ぶ}} {{m|zh|武|tr=mju<sup>X</sup>||military}}.

The [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] reading of ''bu'', so likely a re-borrowing at a later stage of {{etyl|ltc|-}}, or from a dialectal variation in {{etyl|ltc|-}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|ぶ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぶ}}

# [[courage]], [[ferocity]], [[valor]]
# [[military]] [[power]], [[force]] of [[arms]]
# the [[act]] of [[carry out|carrying out]] military force: a [[battle]], a [[war]]
# the [[way]] of [[carry out|carrying out]] military force: [[strategy]], [[tactics]], [[martial art]]s
# a [[military]] [[person]]: an [[officer]], a [[soldier]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=ぶ|obsolete}} a [[unit]] of [[length]], equivalent to half of a {{m|ja|歩|tr=bu|pos=six {{m|ja|尺|tr=shaku}}, roughly six [[feet]] or 1.8 [[meter]]s}}, roughly equivalent to one [[yard]] or 90 [[centimeter]]s
